description: From Middle English militari, from Old French militaire, from Latin mīlitāris, from mīles (“soldier”).

adjectives.description: military (comparative more military, superlative most military)

entries.meaning: Characteristic of members of the armed forces.
examples: She was dishonorably discharged from all military duties.

entries.meaning: (Canada, US) Relating to armed forces such as the army, marines, navy and air force (often as distinguished from civilians or police forces).
examples: If you join a military force, you may end up killing people.

entries.meaning: Relating to armies or ground forces.

examples: He spent six years in the military.
